item.title: Justin add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Justin add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "For instance, on the planet Earth, man had always assumed that he was more intelligent than dolphins because he had achieved so much&mdash;the wheel, New York, wars and so on&mdash;whilst all the dolphins had ever done was muck about in the water having a good time. But conversely, the dolphins had always believed that they were far more intelligent than man&mdash;for precisely the same reasons." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Justin add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Justin add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Justin add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Justin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Justin add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The Guide says there is an art to flying", said Ford, "or rather a knack. The knack lies in learning how to throw yourself at the ground and miss." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Justin add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Some humans would do anything to see if it was possible to do it. If you put a large switch in some cave somewhere, with a sign on it saying 'End-of-the-World Switch. PLEASE DO NOT TOUCH', the paint wouldn't even have time to dry." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Justin add a quote by Rita Mae Brown
item.description: "The statistics on sanity are that one out of every four people is suffering from a mental illness. Look at your 3 best friends. If they're ok, then it's you." -- Rita Mae Brown

item.title: Justin add a quote by Walt Disney
item.description: "It's kind of fun to do the impossible." -- Walt Disney

item.title: Justin add a quote by Andrew Jackson
item.description: "It is a damn poor mind that can think of only one way to spell a word." -- Andrew Jackson

item.title: Justin add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Justin add a quote by Terry Goodkind
item.description: "People are stupid. They will believe a lie because they want to believe it's true, or because they are afraid it might be true." -- Terry Goodkind

item.title: Justin add a quote by Terry Goodkind
item.description: "Nothing gained without cost is valued. Freedom has a cost, and all will bear it so all will value and preserve it." -- Terry Goodkind

item.title: Justin add a quote by Terry Goodkind
item.description: "Deserve Victory" -- Terry Goodkind

item.title: Justin add a quote by Terry Goodkind
item.description: "I often hear people say that they read to escape reality, but I believe that what theyâ€™re really doing is reading to find reason for hope, to find strength. While a bad book leaves readers with a sense of hopelessness and despair, a good novel, through stories of values realized, of wrongs righted, can bring to readers a connection to the wonder of life. A good novel shows how life can and ought to be lived. It not only entertains but energizes and uplifts readers." -- Terry Goodkind

item.title: Justin add a quote by Terry Goodkind
item.description: "The first law of reason is that what exists, exists; what is, is, and that from this ineducible, bedrock principle, all knowledge is built...that is the foundation from which life is embraced... thinking is a choice...wishes and whims are not facts, nor are they a means to discover them... reason is our only way of grasping reality--it's our basic tool of survival. We are free to evade the effort of thinking--to reject reason--but we are not free to avoid the penalty of the abyss we refuse to see... Reason is the very substance of truth itself. The glory that is life is wholly embraced through reason. In rejecting reason one embraces death." -- Terry Goodkind

item.title: Justin add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "Early to bed and early to rise," Mazer intoned, "makes a man stupid and blind in the eyes." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Justin add a quote by Eoin Colfer
item.description: "If I win, I'm a prodigy. If I lose, then I'm crazy. That's the way history is written." -- Eoin Colfer

item.title: Justin add a quote by Eoin Colfer
item.description: "I can't imagine what they're planning. But I can tell you two things. We won't like it, and it won't be legal." -- Eoin Colfer

item.title: Justin add a quote by Eoin Colfer
item.description: "A CD. How quaint. We have these in museums." -- Eoin Colfer

item.title: Justin add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "There is neither happiness nor misery in the world; there is only the comparison of one state with another, nothing more. He who has felt the deepest grief is best able to experience supreme happiness. We must have felt what it is to die, Morrel, that we may appreciate the enjoyments of life. " Live, then, and be happy, beloved children of my heart, and never forget, that until the day God will deign to reveal the future to man, all human wisdom is contained in these two words, 'Wait and Hope." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Justin add a quote by Robert Jordan
item.description: "The Creator made women to please the eye, and to boggle the mind." -- Robert Jordan

item.title: Justin add a quote by Robert Jordan
item.description: "Almost dead yesterday, maybe dead tomorrow, but alive, gloriously alive, today. -- Mat Cauthon" -- Robert Jordan

item.title: Justin add a quote by Robert Jordan
item.description: "If you must mount the gallows, give a jest to the crowd, a coin the hangman, and make the drop with a smile on your lips." -- Robert Jordan

item.title: Justin add a quote by Robert Jordan
item.description: "Surprising what you can dig out of books if you read long enough, isn't it?" -- Robert Jordan

item.title: Justin add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I refuse to answer that question on the grounds that I don't know the answer" -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Justin add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Don't Panic." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Justin add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The fact that we live at the bottom of a deep gravity well, on the surface of a gas covered planet going around a nuclear fireball 90 million miles away and think this to be normal is obviously some indication of how skewed our perspective tends to be." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Justin add a quote by Gene Fowler
item.description: "Writing is easy. You only need to stare at a blank piece of paper until drops of blood form on your forehead." -- Gene Fowler
